basicFear.Summary: Negative self-perception and fear of being viewed as corrupt or defective.

basicDesire.Summary: Desires to be a good and balanced person with integrity.

levelOfDevelopment.Attributes: wise, discerning, accepting, realistic, decisive, humane, inspiring, hopeful, transcendent
levelOfDevelopment.Summary: extraordinarily wise and discerning. accepting what is, they have become transcendentally realistic. Humane, inspiring, and hopeful knowing the truth will be heard

levelOfDevelopment.Attributes: conscientious, strong convictions, moral compass, religious values, rational, reasonable, self-disciplined, mature, moderate
levelOfDevelopment.Summary: conscientious with strong personal convictions. intense sense of right and wrong, personal religious and moral values with a wish to be rational, reasonable, self-disciplined, mature, and moderate in all things

levelOfDevelopment.Attributes: principled, fair, objective, ethical, truth, justice, responsible, integrity, higher purpose, teacher, witness
levelOfDevelopment.Summary: extremely principled; always want to be fair, objective, and ethical. Truth and justice are primary values with a sense of responsibility and personal integrity. They feel like they have a higher purpose that often makes them teachers and witnesses to the truth

levelOfDevelopment.Attributes: dissatisfied, high-minded, idealist, saviour, crusader, critical, advocate, into causes, explaining how things ought to be
levelOfDevelopment.Summary: dissatisfied with reality, which leads them becoming high-minded idealists and feeling that it is up to them to improve everything. These people are crusaders, advocates, and critics and are typically into
and explaining to others how things
to be

levelOfDevelopment.Attributes: afraid, idealistic, orderly, well-organized, impersonal, puritanical, emotionally constricted, rigid, self-suppressing, workaholic, anal-compulsive, punctual, pedantic, fastidious
levelOfDevelopment.Summary: afraid of making mistakes; Everything must be consistent with their ideals. Become orderly and well-organized, but impersonal, puritanical, emotionally constricted, rigidly keeping their feelings and impulses in check. They are often workaholics,
punctual, pedantic, and fastidious

levelOfDevelopment.Attributes: highly critical, picky, judgmental, perfectionistic, opinionated, evangelical, impatient, moralizing, scolding, abrasive, angry
levelOfDevelopment.Summary: highly critical both of self and others: picky, judgmental, perfectionistic. Very opinionated about everything: correcting people and badgering them to
â€”as they see it. Impatient, never satisfied with anything unless it is done according to their prescriptions. Moralizing, scolding, abrasive, and indignantly angry

levelOfDevelopment.Attributes: dogmatic, self-righteous, intolerant, inflexible, dealing in absolutes
levelOfDevelopment.Summary: highly dogmatic, self-righteous, intolerant, and inflexible. Begin to deal in absolutes, believing that they alone know
Everyone else is wrong in their eyes. Very severe in their judgments, while increasingly self-rationalizing.
levelOfDevelopment.ViewofOthers: Everyone else is wrong in their eyes, severe in their judgments, rationalizing their own actions

levelOfDevelopment.Summary: Becomes obsessive about imperfection and the wrongdoing of others, but may act hypocritically by doing the opposite of what they preach.

levelOfDevelopment.Attributes: condemnatory, punitive, cruel, severe depressions, nervous breakdowns, suicide attempts
levelOfDevelopment.Summary: Condemnatory towards others, punitive and cruel. Likely to experience severe depressions, nervous breakdowns, and suicide attempts.

DesireSummary: To strive higher and improve everything
To be consistent with their ideals

addictions.Summary: Uses excessive dieting, cleansing techniques, and alcohol to manage tension; has tendencies toward under-eating, anorexia, and bulimia.

basicFear.Summary: Feeling unwanted and unworthy of being loved.

basicDesire.Summary: Desire to experience the feeling of being loved.

levelOfDevelopment.Summary: Unselfish, humble, and altruistic, giving unconditional love to self and others. Feeling that it is a privilege to be in the lives of others.
levelOfDevelopment.ViewofSelf: They view themselves as unselfish, humble, and altruistic, with the ability to give unconditional love to self and others.
levelOfDevelopment.ViewofOthers: They view others as individuals for whom they feel privileged to be in their lives.

levelOfDevelopment.Summary: Empathetic, compassionate, and caring for others. Thoughtful, warm-hearted, forgiving, and sincere.
levelOfDevelopment.ViewofSelf: They view themselves as empathetic, compassionate, and caring for others, with a thoughtful, warm-hearted, forgiving, and sincere nature.
levelOfDevelopment.ViewofOthers: They view others with concern and care for their needs.

levelOfDevelopment.Summary: Encouraging and appreciative, able to see the good in others. Nurturing, generous, and giving, a truly loving person.
levelOfDevelopment.ViewofSelf: They view themselves as encouraging, appreciative, and able to see the good in others. They are nurturing, generous, and giving.
levelOfDevelopment.ViewofOthers: They view others with a desire to encourage and appreciate, and with a nurturing and generous attitude.

levelOfDevelopment.Summary: People-pleasing, overly friendly, emotionally demonstrative, and giving seductive attention such as approval-seeking and flattery. Love is their supreme value and they talk about it constantly.
levelOfDevelopment.ViewofSelf: They view themselves as individuals who value love above all else, and they seek to please others through emotionally demonstrative behavior and seductive attention.
levelOfDevelopment.ViewofOthers: They view others as individuals they want to be closer to and as individuals who they seek to please through people-pleasing behavior and seductive attention.
levelOfDevelopment.PersonalGoal: Their goal is to be closer to others.

Summary: want others to depend on them
ViewofOthers: want others to depend on them

Summary: tell others how much they owe

keyMotivations.DesireSummary: Desires to feel loved, express their feelings for others, be needed and appreciated, and vindicate their claims about themselves.
keyMotivations.FearSummary: Fears not being loved, having their feelings rejected, being unappreciated, and not being able to vindicate their claims about themselves.

addictions.Summary: The person abuses food and over-the-counter medications, binges on sweets and carbohydrates, over-eats from feeling clove-starved, and may develop bulimia. They also experience hypochondria in search of sympathy.

basicDesire.Summary: Desire to feel valuable and worthwhile

levelOfDevelopment.ViewofSelf: Self-accepting, inner-directed, authentic, modest, charitable, with self-deprecatory humor and a fullness of heart.
Self-assured, energetic, and competent with high self-esteem; adaptable, desirable, charming, and gracious.
Ambitious to improve themselves, to be 'the best they can be'--often become outstanding, a human ideal, embodying widely admired cultural qualities.
levelOfDevelopment.PersonalGoal: Ambitious to improve themselves, to be 'the best they can be'

levelOfDevelopment.Summary: Highly driven and competitive
levelOfDevelopment.MentalHealthSummary: Fear of failure and low self-worth
levelOfDevelopment.ViewofSelf: Self-worth is tied to achievement and status
levelOfDevelopment.PersonalGoal: To be successful and achieve high status

Attributes: Highly concerned with how they are perceived
Package themselves according to the expectations of others
levelOfDevelopment.Summary: Image-conscious and efficient
levelOfDevelopment.MentalHealthSummary: Difficulty connecting with emotions and being genuine
levelOfDevelopment.ViewofSelf: Self-image is based on perception of others
levelOfDevelopment.PersonalGoal: To be successful and perceived as competent

levelOfDevelopment.Summary: Narcissistic and grandiose
levelOfDevelopment.MentalHealthSummary: Inflated sense of self-importance and insecurity
levelOfDevelopment.PersonalGoal: To be perceived as superior to others

levelOfDevelopment.Summary: Driven to succeed, compare self with others, fear failure
levelOfDevelopment.MentalHealthSummary: Terrified of failure, driven by fear of not being good enough
levelOfDevelopment.ViewofSelf: Self-worth tied to achievement and success, always striving to be the best
levelOfDevelopment.ViewofOthers: Comparison to others to establish status and worth
levelOfDevelopment.PersonalGoal: Achieve goals, attain status and success

levelOfDevelopment.Summary: Focused on success, losing touch with emotions, concerned with perception
levelOfDevelopment.MentalHealthSummary: Lack of connection to emotions, problems with intimacy and credibility
levelOfDevelopment.ViewofSelf: Self-worth tied to success and perception of others
levelOfDevelopment.ViewofOthers: See others as tools to achieve success

levelOfDevelopment.Summary: Deceptive, vindictive, malicious
levelOfDevelopment.ViewofSelf: Inflated sense of superiority, delusionally jealous of others
levelOfDevelopment.ViewofOthers: See others as obstacles to success, attempt to ruin others' happiness
levelOfDevelopment.PersonalGoal: Destroy whatever reminds them of their own shortcomings and failures

keyMotivations.DesireSummary: The desire to be recognized, admired and stand out from others.
keyMotivations.FearSummary: The fear of being ignored, overlooked, or not being seen as special.

addictions.Summary: Engaging harmful behaviors, such as over-stressing the body, working out to exhaustion, starvation diets, workaholism, excessive intake of stimulants and drugs, and excessive surgery for cosmetic improvement.

basicFear.Summary: The person feels that they lack a sense of identity or personal significance.

basicDesire.Summary: To find themselves and their significance

levelOfDevelopment.Summary: Expressive of personal and universal themes through creative means.
levelOfDevelopment.View of Self Summary: Views self as creative and able to transform experiences into something valuable.
levelOfDevelopment.Goal Summary: To express personal and universal themes through creative means and to continually renew and regenerate oneself through this process.

levelOfDevelopment.Summary: On a search for self, aware of feelings and inner impulses. Sensitive and intuitive both to self and others.

Attributes: ironic view of self and life
levelOfDevelopment.Summary: Highly personal and individualistic with a sense of self-revelation and emotional honesty, and an ironic view of self and life that is both serious and funny, while being vulnerable and emotionally strong.
levelOfDevelopment.Mental Health Summary: Possessing emotional honesty and self-awareness can be beneficial for mental health.
levelOfDevelopment.View of Self Summary: Has a strong sense of self and self-expression while also acknowledging their own vulnerabilities and weaknesses.
levelOfDevelopment.View of Others Summary: Sensitive and compassionate towards others while also maintaining a highly individualistic view of the world.
levelOfDevelopment.Goal Summary: To be true to themselves, express their individuality, and maintain emotional honesty and self-awareness.

levelOfDevelopment.Summary: Create a beautiful and aesthetic environment to cultivate and prolong personal feelings.
levelOfDevelopment.Mental Health Summary: May be prone to escapism and living in a fantasy world.
levelOfDevelopment.View of Others Summary: May expect others to appreciate and participate in their artistic and romantic ideals.
levelOfDevelopment.Goal Summary: To heighten reality through fantasy, passionate feelings, and the imagination.

levelOfDevelopment.Summary: Stay withdrawn to protect their self-image and to buy time to sort out feelings.
levelOfDevelopment.Mental Health Summary: May struggle with excessive introspection and self-absorption that can lead to moodiness and hypersensitivity.
levelOfDevelopment.View of Self Summary: Tends to take everything personally, becoming self-absorbed and introverted, and may struggle with shyness and self-consciousness.
levelOfDevelopment.View of Others Summary: May withdraw to protect their self-image and to sort out their feelings.
levelOfDevelopment.Goal Summary: To stay in touch with their feelings.

levelOfDevelopment.Summary: Think they are different from others and live in a fantasy world, becoming increasingly self-indulgent and impractical.
levelOfDevelopment.Mental Health Summary: Possible risk of depression, narcissism, and detachment from reality.
levelOfDevelopment.View of Self Summary: Views themselves as unique and exempt from living as others do.
levelOfDevelopment.View of Others Summary: May feel envious of others and disdainful towards them.
levelOfDevelopment.Goal Summary: Goal is to live a life that is different from the norm and to indulge in their fantasies.

levelOfDevelopment.Summary: The individual is plagued by a sense of self-contempt, self-reproach, and self-hatred. They struggle with morbid thoughts and blame others for their problems.
levelOfDevelopment.Mental Health Summary: The individual is tormented by delusional self-contempt, self-reproaches, self-hatred, and morbid thoughts. They may be experiencing mental health issues such as depression, anxiety, or psychosis.
levelOfDevelopment.View of Self Summary: The individual has a negative view of themselves, struggling with self-contempt and self-hatred. They may have low self-esteem and struggle with self-worth.
levelOfDevelopment.View of Others Summary: The individual blames others for their problems and may push people away when they try to help.

levelOfDevelopment.Mental Health Summary: Feel hopeless and may experience emotional breakdown or suicide.
levelOfDevelopment.View of Self Summary: Negative view of self, possibly experiencing self-hatred or self-reproach.
levelOfDevelopment.View of Others Summary: Blaming others and pushing them away when they try to help.

keyMotivations.DesireSummary: The desire to express themselves, their individuality, create and surround themselves with beauty, maintain certain moods and feelings, withdraw to protect their self-image, take care of emotional needs before attending to anything else, and attract a rescuer.
keyMotivations.FearSummary: Fears not being able to express themselves fully, being unable to create or surround themselves with beauty, losing control of their emotional state, and not having someone to rescue them.

addictions.Summary: Engaging in unhealthy behaviors like overeating, alcohol consumption, lack of physical activity, and drug abuse to cope with negative emotions or social anxiety. Bulimia, depression, and cosmetic surgery are also common means of dealing with feelings of rejection and low self-esteem.

PositiveAttributes: able to concentrate and focus on developing complex ideas and skills
NegativeAttributes: preoccupied with their thoughts and imaginary constructs

basicFear.Summary: Feeling inadequate and lacking ability or value.

levelOfDevelopment: Become visionaries, broadly comprehending the world while penetrating it profoundly. Open-minded, take things in whole, in their true context. Make pioneering discoveries and find entirely new ways of doing and perceiving things.

Observe everything with extraordinary perceptiveness and insight. Most mentally alert, curious, searching intelligence: nothing escapes their notice. Foresight and prediction. Able to concentrate: become engrossed in what has caught their attention.

Attain skillful mastery of whatever interests them. Excited by knowledge: often become expert in some field. Innovative and inventive, producing extremely valuable, original works. Highly independent, idiosyncratic, and whimsical.

Begin conceptualizing and fine-tuning everything before actingâ€”working things out in their minds: model building, preparing, practicing, and gathering more resources. Studious, acquiring technique. Become specialized, and often
often challenging accepted ways of doing things.

Increasingly detached as they become involved with complicated ideas or imaginary worlds. Become preoccupied with their visions and interpretations rather than reality. Are fascinated by off-beat, esoteric subjects, even those involving dark and disturbing elements. Detached from the practical world, a
although high-strung and intense.

Begin to take an antagonistic stance toward anything which would interfere with their inner world and personal vision. Become provocative and abrasive, with intentionally extreme and radical views. Cynical and argumentative.
Become reclusive and isolated from reality, eccentric and nihilistic. Highly unstable and fearful of aggressions: they reject and repulse others and all social attachments.
Get obsessed yet frightened by their threatening ideas, becoming horrified, delirious, and prey to gross distortions and phobias.

Seeking oblivion, they may commit suicide or have a psychotic break with reality. Deranged, explosively self-destructive, with schizophrenic overtones. Generally corresponds to the Schizoid Avoidant and Schizotypal personality disorders.

keyMotivations.DesireSummary: Desire to possess knowledge, understand the environment, and have everything figured out as a way of defending the self from threats from the environment.
keyMotivations.FearSummary: Fear of not having knowledge or understanding, of being vulnerable to threats from the environment.

addictions.Summary: Neglecting personal needs and using drugs to cope with mental and emotional issues.

levelOfDevelopment: Become self-affirming, trusting of self and others, independent yet symbiotically interdependent and cooperative as an equal. Belief in self leads to true courage, positive thinking, leadership, and rich self-expression.
Able to elicit strong emotional responses from others: very appealing, endearing, lovable, affectionate. Trust important: bonding with others, forming permanent relationships and alliances.

Dedicated to individuals and movements in which they deeply believe. Community builders: responsible, reliable, trustworthy. Hard-working and persevering, sacrificing for others, they create stability and security in their world, bringing a cooperative spirit.

Start investing their time and energy into whatever they believe will be safe and stable. Organizing and structuring, they look to alliances and authorities for security and continuity. Constantly vigilant, anticipating problems.

To resist having more demands made on them, they react against others passive-aggressively. Become evasive, indecisive, cautious, procrastinating, and ambivalent. Are highly reactive, anxious, and negative, giving contradictory,
Internal confusion makes them react unpredictably.
To compensate for insecurities, they become sarcastic and belligerent, blaming others for their problems, taking a tough stance toward

Highly reactive and defensive, dividing people into friends and enemies, while looking for threats to their own security. Authoritarian while fearful of authority, highly suspicious, yet, conspiratorial, and fear-instilling to silence their own fears.

Fearing that they have ruined their security, they become panicky, volatile, and self-disparaging with acute inferiority feelings. Seeing themselves as defenseless, they seek out a stronger authority or belief to resolve all problems. Highly divisive, disparaging and berating others
Feeling persecuted, that others are
they lash-out and act irrationally, bringing about what they fear. Fanaticism, violence.

Hysterical, and seeking to escape punishment, they become self-destructive and suicidal. Alcoholism, drug overdoses, self-abasing behavior. Generally corresponds to the Passive-Aggressive and Paranoid personality disorders.

keyMotivations.DesireSummary: Desire to have security and feel supported by others, to have certitude and reassurance, to test the attitudes of others toward them.

addictions.Summary: Rigidity in diet causes nutritional imbalances, working excessively, caffeine and amphetamines for stamina but also alcohol and depressants to deaden anxiety. Higher susceptibility to alcoholism than many types.

basicDesire.Summary: To be satisfied, content, and to have their needs fulfilled.

levelOfDevelopment: Assimilate experiences in depth, making them deeply grateful and appreciative for what they have. Become awed by the simple wonders of life: joyous and ecstatic. Intimations of spiritual reality, of the boundless goodness of life.

Highly responsive, excitable, enthusiastic about sensation and experience. Most extroverted type: stimuli bring immediate responsesâ€”they find everything invigorating. Lively, vivacious, eager, spontaneous, resilient, cheerful.
Easily become accomplished achievers, generalists who do many different things well: multi-talented. Practical, productive, usually prolific, cross-fertilizing areas of interest.
As restlessness increases, want to have more options and choices available to them. Become adventurous and
but less focused, constantly seeking new things and experiences: the sophisticate, connoisseur, and consumer. Money, variety, keeping up with the latest trends important.
Unable to discriminate what they really need, become hyperactive, unable to say

to themselves, throwing self into constant activity. Uninhibited, doing and saying whatever comes to mind: storytelling, flamboyant exaggerations, witty wise-cracking, performing. Fear being bored: in perpetual motion, but do too many thingsâ€”many ideas but little follow through.

Get into conspicuous consumption and all forms of excess. Self-centered, materialistic, and greedy, never feeling that they have enough. Demanding and pushy, yet unsatisfied and jaded. Addictive, hardened, and insensitive.
Desperate to quell their anxieties, can be impulsive and infantile: do not know when to stop. Addictions and excess take their toll: debauched, depraved, dissipated escapists, offensive and abusive.
In flight from self, acting out impulses rather than dealing with anxiety or frustrations: go out of control, into erratic mood swings, and compulsive actions (manias).

Finally, their energy and health is completely spent: become claustrophobic and panic-stricken. Often give up on themselves and life: deep depression and despair, self-destructive overdoses, impulsive suicide. Generally corresponds to the Bipolar disorder and Histrionic personality disorder.

keyMotivations.DesireSummary: Maintain freedom and happiness, avoid missing out on worthwhile experiences, keep oneself excited and occupied.

addictions.Summary: The type most prone to addictions: stimulants (caffeine, cocaine, and amphetamines), Ecstasy, psychotropics, narcotics, and alcohol but tend to avoid other depressants. Wear body out with effort to stay

basicFear.Summary: The fear or experience of being harmed or controlled by others, leading to feelings of powerlessness and victimization. This can include abuse, trauma, and oppression.

basicDesire.Summary: To protect themselves and to be in control of their own life.

levelOfDevelopment: Become self-restrained and magnanimous, merciful and forbearing, mastering self through their self-surrender to a higher authority. Courageous, willing to put self in serious jeopardy to achieve their vision and have a lasting influence. May achieve true heroism and historical greatness.
Self-assertive, self-confident, and strong: have learned to stand up for what they need and want. A resourceful,
attitude and passionate inner drive.

Decisive, authoritative, and commanding: the natural leader others look up to. Take initiative, make things happen: champion people, provider, protective, and honorable, carrying others with their strength.
Self-sufficiency, financial independence, and having enough resources are important concerns: become enterprising, pragmatic,
wheeler-dealers. Risk-taking, hardworking, denying own emotional needs.
Begin to dominate their environment, including others: want to feel that others are behind them, supporting their efforts. Swaggering, boastful, forceful, and expansive: the
whose word is law. Proud, egocentric, want to impose their will and vision on everything, not seeing others as equals or treating them with respect.

Become highly combative and intimidating to get their way: confrontational, belligerent, creating adversarial relationships. Everything a test of wills, and they will not back down. Use threats and reprisals to get obedience from others, to keep others off balance and insecure. However, unjust treatment makes others fear and resent them, possibly also band together against them.
Defying any attempt to control them, become completely ruthless, dictatorial,
The criminal and outlaw, renegade, and con-artist. Hard-hearted, immoral and potentially violent.
Develop delusional ideas about their power, invincibility, and ability to prevail: megalomania, feeling omnipotent, invulnerable. Recklessly over-extending self.

If they get in danger, they may brutally destroy everything that has not conformed to their will rather than surrender to anyone else. Vengeful, barbaric, murderous. Sociopathic tendencies. Generally corresponds to the Antisocial Personality Disorder.

keyMotivations.DesireSummary: To prove their strength, resist weakness, be important, dominate the environment, and stay in control of their situation.
keyMotivations.FearSummary: Losing control, being weak or dependent on others.

addictions.Summary: The individual tends to ignore physical needs and problems, avoid medical visits and check-ups. They indulge in rich foods, alcohol, and tobacco while pushing themselves too hard, leading to high stress, strokes, and heart conditions. Control issues are central, although alcoholism and narcotic addictions are possible.

basicDesire.Summary: The desire is to have a sense of inner stability and peace of mind.

levelOfDevelopment: Become self-possessed, feeling autonomous and fulfilled: have great equanimity and contentment because they are present to themselves. Paradoxically, at one with self, and thus able to form more profound relationships. Intensely alive, fully connected to self and others.

Deeply receptive, accepting, unselfconscious, emotionally stable and serene. Trusting of self and others, at ease with self and life, innocent and simple. Patient, unpretentious, good-natured, genuinely nice people.
Optimistic, reassuring, supportive: have a healing and calming influenceâ€”harmonizing groups, bringing people together: a good mediator, synthesizer, and communicator.
Fear conflicts, so become self-effacing and accommodating, idealizing others and
with their wishes, saying
to things they do not really want to do. Fall into conventional roles and expectations. Use philosophies and stock sayings to deflect others.
Active, but disengaged, unreflective, and inattentive. Do not want to be affected, so become unresponsive and complacent, walking away from problems, and
Thinking becomes hazy and ruminative, mostly comforting fantasies, as they begin to
reality, becoming oblivious. Emotionally indolent, unwillingness to exert self or to focus on problems: indifference.
Begin to minimize problems, to appease others and to have

Stubborn, fatalistic, and resigned, as if nothing could be done to change anything. Into wishful thinking, and magical solutions. Others frustrated and angry by their procrastination and unresponsiveness.
Can be highly repressed, undeveloped, and ineffectual. Feel incapable of facing problems: become obstinate, dissociating self from all conflicts. Neglectful and dangerous to others.
Wanting to block out of awareness anything that could affect them, they dissociate so much that they eventually cannot function: numb, depersonalized.

They finally become severely disoriented and catatonic, abandoning themselves, turning into shattered shells. Multiple personalities possible. Generally corresponds to the Schizoid and Dependent personality disorders.

FearSummary: resist whatever would upset or disturb them

addictions.Summary: Over-eating or under-eating due to lack of self-awareness and repressed anger. Lack of physical activity. Depressants and psychotropics, alcohol, marijuana, narcotics to deaden loneliness and anxiety.
